body:
thanks for everyone`s reply, i am trying to find out what are the minimum set of file for go environment. most of the folder does self exlained themself, but folder like "lib" and "include" still confused me, see blow:

- .git
for git repo, self explained

- api
[README](https://github.com/golang/go/blob/master/api/README) says it is data for API checker, does it mean is for testing? why not under test folder?

- bin
  go binary, where go.exe are, self explained

- blog
article for Go Blog? not related to code i believe!?

- doc
documentation folder, self explained

- include
README says it is for GC, so i believe it is important, must keep

- lib
there is a "time" folder under it, by itself it is data for timezone, so does go depends on it in runtime?

- misc
i believe it is not contains any code that go would depends in runtime ?

- src
self explained

- test
self explained
